definition: a steelyard (a type of balance)
pole/CL:條|条[tiao2],根[gen1]
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns
steelyard/Roman balance/CL:臺|台[tai2]
variant of 稱|称[cheng1], to weigh

sentences.english: Today this is known as a ★ steelyard scale 13 .
sentences.chinese: 如今这种天平被称作“杆秤”。

sentences.english: Weigh this ring in the small steelyard .
sentences.chinese: 把这个戒指在杆秤上称一称。

sentences.english: This kind of lever scale is very exact and is used by many consumers.
sentences.chinese: 这杆秤非常精准，买菜的人都用它。

sentences.english: The lever device in this paper refers in particular to balance and steelyard.
sentences.chinese: 本文所述杠杆装置特指权衡器，包括天平和杆秤。

sentences.english: Steelyard was gradually developed from balance.
sentences.chinese: 杆秤是由天平逐步发展而来的。

sentences.english: Good or bad, everyone seems to have an opinion about Mr.
sentences.chinese: 朱先生的好坏功过，每个人心中都有一杆秤。

definition: the beam of a steelyard/a balance arm
the tray or pan of a steelyard
steelyard weight/standard weight
balance consisting of steelyard with a pan/CL:臺|台[tai2]
steelyard hook
carrying pole and its load
large wicker basket
cheating neither old nor young/treating youngsters and old folk equally scrupulously/Our house offers sincere treatment to all and fair trade to old and young alike.
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
cooper/hooper
steelyard weight/stone roller/to polish jade with an emery wheel
desire for the public good/sense of fair play
lit. to count on a narrow abacus (idiom); petty and scheming selfishly/concerned with petty interests/selfish and uncaring of the interests of others/bean counter
central point/in one's thoughts/in one's heart
lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom)/fig. to be impartial
stone roller
